page.text: Alyssa Harding
Graduate and Volunteer in the Field of Environmental Science
809 Dexter Street, Apt 310 - Denver, CO 80220
fraulyssa@yahoo.com - 352.642.4502
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
-Independently motivated, diligent and accomplished candidate, with a proven background in effectively
executing multiple high-priority responsibilities. Educational foundation in Environmental Science
achieved solely through personal finances, while balancing academic objectives with concurrent work
responsibilities.
-Recognized excellence in leadership, professionalism, and a broad array of communication skills.
Independent inspiration best accomplished when aligned with a team focused on continuous
development, expanding responsibilities, and the opportunity to be impactful on the shared goals of the
company.
WORK EXPERIENCE
Financial Administrator
Work for Progress- Denver, CO - August 2014 to Present
-Currently employed as a Financial Director for Work for Progress, a non-profit entity where
responsibilities include maintaining the organization’s financial records using the QuickBooks accounting
program, handling accounts payable and receivable, tracking income and producing financial reports,
and assisting with the annual audit & tax preparation process with outside accountants.
-Also includes managing monthly reconciliation; credit card maintenance and account allocation. Also
assists with the preparation of the annual and mid-year budgets, and with the team, assists with the
fiscal year-end accounting.
Expert in Food Science (Writer)
PowerHouse Growers – Denver, CO – September 2014 to Present
-Writer for Powerhouse growers, where responsibilities include publishing solutions for integrated
vegetation, urban agriculture, smart cities, and green real estate resulting in better urban health,
increased productivity, and lower environmental impact.
-Expert in food science and natural resource policies.
Server
Olive Garden/Darden - Gainesville, FL/Denver, CO - February 2011 to Present
-Responsibilities included creating a positive customer experience, customer loyalty and demonstrating
a commitment to the business model while handling payments, serving food, answering phones,
partnering with teammates and quickly resolving customer complaints or concerns.
-Active member of the Sustainability Team, which utilized both the tenure established with the company
and a rapport with both superiors and colleagues to promote more sustainable decision making.
Office Administrator
SkySystems, Inc - DeLand, FL - February 2008 to August 2008
-Customer facing responsibilities included working directly with the owner/President of the company,
collaborating with all team members, managing phone inquiries, inventory management, review and
management of financial data via QuickBooks, handling all product delivery issues and bank transfers.
-Earned a trusted relationship with company leadership and peers, based upon interpersonal skills,
customer service tactics, and demonstrated accountability around targeted goals.
EDUCATION
Bachelor’s Degree in Environmental Science
University of Florida - Gainesville, FL
The Bachelor of the Arts in Environmental science is a strong and comprehensive degree program which
combines basic and applied sciences to give students an interdisciplinary understanding of natural
resource use and of the growing human impact on the environment. With a curriculum that included the
study of microeconomics and macroeconomics, statistics, and calculus, the Bachelor of the Arts program
enables its students to evaluate data and to study rates of change in order to devise and test potential
solutions to social problems. By giving its students an ability to choose electives based on personal
interest, this program allowed for a specialization in hydrogeology and in agriculture oriented natural
resource policy.
This program led to the development of critical thinking skills that allow its students to deal with the
complex and dynamic nature of environmental science, and to respond effectively to challenges and
opportunities that might arise in their professional lives. Despite multiple work-life challenges, was a
candidate for Dean's List Dec 2013, and achieved a core GPA of 3.28. Active volunteer with the GTM
(Guana Tolomoto Matanzas) Research Reserve, which is a private, non-profit citizen organization that
promotes environmental education, natural and cultural stewardship, and scientific research with an
estuarine focus.
DeLand High School - DeLand, FL - August 2004 to May 2008
International Baccalaureate Diploma DeLand, Florida
Aug 2004 - May 2008
-Graduated Summa Cum Laude, with a cumulative GPA of 4.7, leading to acceptance into one of the
country's most coveted universities, University of Florida.
-Successfully completed over 200 hours of community service. Areas served included meeting
community, action, and service hours through a variety of sponsored clubs and associations. An active
member of the Key Club/Kiwanis Club, an international student-led organization which provides its
members with opportunities to provide service, build character and develop leadership. Also a member
of Teen Court, which is a social learning based crime prevention and juvenile alternative services
organization that provides volunteers with experience and education about the court system while
inspiring integrity and responsibility in the community.
